entities.name: kettle
entities.description: The kettle is described as 'dusty' and Harry peered inside it to check if it needs water. It's a physical object that the group needs for their camping trip.

entities.name: tap
entities.description: The tap is mentioned on a map given by a Muggle (non-magical person) and is located on the other side of the field. It's a physical fixture that provides water.

entities.name: map
entities.description: The map is described as being given by a Muggle and contains information about the location of the tap. It's a written document that helps the group navigate their surroundings.

entities.name: oven
entities.description: The oven is mentioned as an alternative to cooking on a fire, but Mr. Weasley insists they cook outdoors for anti-Muggle security reasons. It's a physical appliance that the group has access to.

entities.name: fire
entities.description: The fire is mentioned as a way of cooking outdoors and is part of the group's camping setup. It's a physical structure that provides heat for cooking.

entities.name: wood
entities.description: The wood is mentioned as something the group needs to gather for their fire. It's a natural resource that they need to collect.

entities.name: Mr. Weasley
entities.description: Mr. Weasley is described as handing over the kettle and saucepans to Harry and Hermione, and explaining the importance of cooking outdoors for anti-Muggle security reasons. He's a person with authority in the group.

entities.name: Harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as going with Hermione to get water from the tap, and is given the kettle and saucepans by Mr. Weasley. He's a person with a key role in the group.

entities.name: Hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as going with Harry to get water from the tap, and is given the kettle and saucepans by Mr. Weasley. She's a person with a key role in the group.

entities.name: Ron
entities.description: Ron is mentioned as following Harry into the tent, and questioning why they can't just use the oven instead of cooking on a fire. He's a person with a key role in the group.

relationships.description: Harry is given the kettle by Mr. Weasley to go and get water.
Mr. Weasley hands over the kettle to Harry and Hermione.
Harry goes with Hermione to get water from the tap.
Ron suggests using the oven instead of cooking on a fire, but Mr. Weasley insists they cook outdoors for anti-Muggle security reasons.
